record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Main menu" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: This menu is the primary, or root, menu in Service Manager.
From the MAIN MENU, all the primary system modules are available using function keys.

detail.detail: Use the Command line to specify a command string directly, to call a menu, application, or stored query.
Command strings perform the same functions as the function keys displayed on the menu.
Typing the command "ops" (without the quotation marks) on the command line and pressing Enter performs the same operation as pressing the function key that corresponds to Support Operations.

The command line also performs several shortcut operations. These operations require that you enter an asterisk (*) followed by a key letter and then a parameter. No spaces should occur between the asterisk, letter and parameter:
*fxxx, where xxx is replaced with a form name, will call database directly and pass to it the form name you have specified.
*mxxx, where xxx is replaced with a menu name, will call the menu manager and pass it the menu name you have specified.
*qxxx, where xxx is replaced with the name of a stored query, will call database and pass it the specified query. Refer to the on-line help for more details about menus, commands, and shortcuts.
